newsitem.title: FRANCE: Air CAT launches "Jet Bag" service.
newsitem.headline: Air CAT launches "Jet Bag" service.

text.p: Air CAT, air freight subsidiary of French forwarder, Compagnie d'Affretement et de Transport (CAT), said it had launched a new product aimed at air travellers with excess baggage problems.

The service, named, "Jet Bag," is aimed at both business travellers who are transporting plans, samples or spare parts for example and non-business travellers with personal effects such as skis or a wind-surfing equipment, an Air CAT official told Reuters.

"Airlines charge around 1.5 percent the cost of a first class airfare, per kilo, for excess baggage which can be considerably more expensive than if it was transported as freight and this where our Jet Bag service comes in," he added.
Marketed as a secure door-to-door home to hotel service to destinations worldwide, Jet Bag also avoids often lengthy and tedious administrative procedures on departure and arrival at airports.
The Jet Bag service also comprises special packaging for baggage in conformity with freight transport regulations. Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax+5017
